revised_title: Spontaneous Crystallization of Monochloracetic Acid and Naphthalene Mixtures
tldr: The authors studied the spontaneous crystallization of monochloracetic acid and its mixtures with naphthalene. They discovered three different modifications of monochloracetic acid and established three supersolubility curves and four solubility curves for the mixtures. The research showed that each modification of a polymorphous substance has a unique temperature for spontaneous crystallization in its mixtures with another substance.
